definitions: bring something to a finish or conclusion
come to a termination or cease to exist
the final part or extremity of something
examples: Let's end the meeting with a summary of decisions
The movie ends with a surprising plot twist revelation
All good things must end eventually in life
Their relationship ended after five years together sadly
We live at the end of a quiet street
Hold the rope at both ends while pulling tightly

definitions: need something as necessary essential or very important for a purpose
officially demand or establish as a rule that something must be done
depend on or have as a necessary condition
examples: This job requires excellent communication skills and patience
All plants require water and sunlight to survive
The law requires drivers to wear seatbelts always
Students are required to submit assignments on time
Success requires hard work and dedication every day
This recipe requires fresh ingredients for best results

definitions: pay attention to sounds or what someone is saying
take notice of and act on what someone says
secretly monitor conversations or communications
examples: Please listen carefully to the instructions before starting
I love to listen to music while working
You should listen to your doctor's advice seriously
Children don't always listen to their parents unfortunately
Intelligence agencies listen to suspicious phone calls regularly
Someone might be listening to our conversation right now

definitions: have the same opinion about something as someone else
consent to do something or allow something to happen
match correspond or be consistent with something
examples: I completely agree with your assessment of the situation
We all agree that changes need to be made
She agreed to help with the project next week
They finally agreed to our terms and conditions
The witness statements don't agree with the evidence
Your actions must agree with your words always

definitions: divide separate or make an opening with a sharp tool
reduce the amount size or quantity of something
stop doing or having something suddenly
examples: Please cut the cake into equal pieces for everyone
She cut her finger while chopping vegetables yesterday
We need to cut expenses to balance the budget
The company cut salaries by ten percent this year
He cut sugar from his diet completely last month
Let's cut the small talk and get to business

definitions: make a choice or judgment after considering options
determine or settle the outcome of something
make a firm resolution to do something
examples: I can't decide what to wear to the party
The committee will decide on the winner tomorrow
One goal decided the championship match last night
This evidence could decide the case in our favor
She decided to pursue a career in medicine
We've decided that moving is the best option

definitions: go past or move beyond something or someone
succeed in a test examination or inspection
transfer something to another person or place
examples: Several cars passed us on the highway today
Time passes quickly when you're having fun
She passed all her exams with excellent grades
The bill passed in Congress by a narrow margin
Please pass the salt across the table now
He passed the ball to his teammate perfectly

definitions: put food in mouth chew and swallow it
gradually destroy or use up something
worry or bother someone persistently
examples: Let's eat dinner before the movie starts tonight
I usually eat breakfast at seven o'clock daily
Rust is eating away at the metal fence
Inflation eats into our savings every year unfortunately
What's eating you today you seem upset
Guilt has been eating at him for years

definitions: give a spoken or written account of something
present oneself formally at a particular place
make a formal complaint about someone or something
examples: The journalist will report on the election results
Please report your findings to the committee tomorrow
New recruits must report to headquarters at eight
Report to my office immediately after the meeting
I need to report a theft to the police
Several employees reported harassment to human resources department

definitions: put forward an idea or plan for consideration
indicate something indirectly or without stating it directly
cause one to think of something because of similarity
examples: I suggest we take a different approach here
Can you suggest a good restaurant for dinner tonight
The evidence suggests he was lying about his whereabouts
Her tone suggested she wasn't happy with the decision
This painting suggests the work of Monet somehow
The smell of cookies suggests childhood memories instantly

definitions: give or hand over something in exchange for money
persuade someone to accept or approve of something
betray someone or something for personal gain
examples: They plan to sell their house next year
This store sells organic vegetables and fruits exclusively
It's hard to sell this idea to management
He really knows how to sell himself in interviews
He sold his friends out to save himself
She would never sell her principles for money

definitions: bear all or part of the weight of something
give assistance encouragement or approval to someone
provide evidence or proof for a statement or theory
examples: These beams support the entire roof structure safely
Can this chair support my weight without breaking
We support local businesses in our community always
Her family supports her decision to study abroad
The data supports our hypothesis about climate change
No evidence supports his claim of innocence unfortunately

definitions: get accept or take something that is given or sent
greet or welcome guests or visitors formally
detect or pick up broadcast signals or transmissions
examples: I received your email yesterday thank you kindly
She received many gifts on her birthday celebration
The ambassador will receive foreign dignitaries tomorrow afternoon
They received us warmly at their home yesterday
Can you receive this radio station clearly here
The antenna receives signals from the satellite directly

definitions: establish something on a particular foundation or principle
station someone or something at a particular location
use something as the starting point for development
examples: We base our decisions on facts not opinions
The company is based in New York City
The military will base troops at the border
They based their operations in the capital city
The movie is based on a true story
She based her novel on personal experiences entirely

definitions: choose or select someone or something from alternatives
gather or harvest flowers fruit or similar items
remove small pieces or unwanted parts from something
examples: Pick a card any card from the deck
I'll pick you up at seven o'clock tonight
We went to pick strawberries at the farm
Children love to pick flowers in the garden
Don't pick at your food just eat it
Stop picking your nose in public please immediately

definitions: operate and control a motor vehicle
provide the motivation or energy for something
force someone or something to go somewhere
examples: She drives to work every morning at eight
Can you drive a manual transmission car proficiently
Ambition drives her to succeed in everything attempted
What drives people to take such risks daily
The storm drove us indoors for safety quickly
They drove the cattle across the plains slowly

definitions: arrive at or get to a place or position
stretch out an arm to touch or grasp something
succeed in achieving or attaining a goal
examples: We should reach the summit by noon today
The news reached us late last night unfortunately
Can you reach the top shelf without a ladder
The vine reaches all the way to the roof
She finally reached her goal of becoming doctor
Sales reached an all-time high this quarter surprisingly

definitions: stay in the same place or position
continue to exist especially after others have gone
be left over after others have been removed
examples: Please remain seated until the plane stops completely
She remained calm during the emergency situation admirably
Some questions remain unanswered after the investigation concluded
The memory of that day remains vivid still
Only three cookies remain in the jar now
What remains of the ancient city attracts tourists

definitions: make something clear by describing it in detail
give reasons for one's actions or behavior
be the reason for or cause of something
examples: Can you explain how this machine works please
The teacher explained the concept using simple examples
Please explain why you were late this morning
He couldn't explain his strange behavior yesterday adequately
What explains the sudden change in weather patterns
This theory explains many observed phenomena in physics

definitions: strike someone or something with force
reach or achieve a target goal or destination
affect someone or something suddenly and powerfully
examples: Don't hit your brother that's not nice behavior
The ball hit the window and broke it
The arrow hit the target dead center perfectly
Our sales hit the million dollar mark yesterday
The storm will hit the coast tonight unfortunately
The reality of the situation suddenly hit me

definitions: exert force to draw someone or something toward oneself
attract influence or persuade someone to do something
withdraw from an activity commitment or contest
examples: Pull the door open it doesn't push outward
The dentist had to pull two teeth today
Her performance pulled large crowds every night consistently
What pulled you toward this career path initially
They had to pull out of the competition
The company pulled the product from store shelves

definitions: lift or move something to a higher position
increase the amount level or strength of something
bring up and care for children until adulthood
examples: Raise your hand if you know the answer
They raised the flag at sunrise this morning
The company plans to raise prices next month
We need to raise funds for the charity event
They raised three children in this house together
My grandparents raised me after my parents died

definitions: have clothing jewelry or accessories on one's body
damage or deteriorate through continuous use
cause to become tired weak or less effective
examples: What should I wear to the job interview
She wears glasses for reading small print only
The carpet is wearing thin in high-traffic areas
Constant use has worn the gears down considerably
This constant stress is wearing me down completely
His patience was wearing thin with the delays

definitions: come or go back to a place or person
give put or send something back to someone
yield or produce profit or interest
examples: I'll return home after the conference ends tomorrow
The birds return to this area every spring
Please return the library books by Friday afternoon
She returned the defective product for a refund
This investment should return good profits over time
The bonds return five percent interest per year

definitions: pick out or select from alternatives or possibilities
decide on a course of action from possibilities
prefer or wish to do something
examples: Choose your favorite color from these paint samples
I can't choose between chocolate and vanilla ice cream
She chose to study medicine over law school
We must choose our battles wisely in life
I choose to believe people are basically good
If I could choose I'd live by the ocean

definitions: make something happen or bring about an effect
a person or thing that gives rise to action or feeling
a principle aim or movement that one supports
examples: Smoking causes serious health problems including cancer
Don't cause trouble at school today please
What was the cause of the accident yesterday
The root cause of poverty is often complex
She devoted her life to the cause of education
They're raising money for a good cause tonight

definitions: connect or fasten things together to become one
become a member of an organization or group
come together with others to participate in activity
examples: Join these two pieces with strong glue carefully
The rivers join at the base of the mountain
I want to join the chess club this year
She joined the company as a junior analyst
Would you like to join us for dinner tonight
Everyone joined in singing happy birthday together enthusiastically

definitions: impart knowledge or skill to someone through instruction
show someone how to do something by example
cause someone to learn or understand through experience
examples: She teaches mathematics at the local high school
Can you teach me how to play guitar please
His actions teach us about courage and integrity
Parents teach by example more than by words
That experience taught me to be more careful
Life teaches harsh lessons sometimes unfortunately

definitions: grow or cause to grow and become more advanced
create or produce something new over time
start to have or experience something gradually
examples: Children develop at different rates physically and mentally
The town developed from a small village rapidly
Scientists are developing a cure for the disease
We need to develop new marketing strategies immediately
She developed a taste for classical music recently
He's developing feelings for his best friend slowly

definitions: divide something among two or more people equally
have or use something jointly with others
tell someone about thoughts feelings or experiences
examples: Let's share this pizza between the four of us
Children must learn to share their toys nicely
We share an office at work currently together
The twins share many personality traits surprisingly enough
She shared her concerns with the counselor yesterday
Thanks for sharing your story with us today

definitions: transport or move something while holding or supporting it
have something with oneself wherever one goes
support the weight of something
examples: Can you carry these boxes upstairs for me
She carries her baby in a sling everywhere
I always carry identification when traveling anywhere abroad
Do you carry cash or just credit cards
These pillars carry the weight of the roof
The bridge can carry heavy trucks safely across

definitions: fail to hit reach or come into contact with
feel sad about the absence of someone or something
fail to attend or be present for something
examples: He missed the target by several inches unfortunately
I missed my train by just two minutes
I really miss my family when traveling abroad
She misses her old neighborhood and friends terribly
Don't miss the meeting tomorrow morning at nine
He missed three days of work due to illness

definitions: become fully aware of something as a fact
achieve or accomplish something planned or hoped for
convert property or assets into cash
examples: I suddenly realized I'd forgotten my wallet
She didn't realize how late it was getting
He finally realized his dream of becoming pilot
They realized their goal of climbing Mount Everest
We need to realize these assets quickly now
The company realized huge profits from the sale

definitions: rescue someone or something from danger or harm
keep money or resources for future use
avoid wasting or using something unnecessarily
examples: The lifeguard saved three people from drowning yesterday
Doctors worked hard to save the patient's life
I'm saving money for a vacation next year
Save some cake for your brother please
This shortcut will save us time getting there
Turn off lights to save electricity at home

definitions: grab and hold something that is moving through air
capture or trap a person or animal
become infected with an illness
examples: Catch the ball when I throw it to you
She caught the glass before it hit the floor
The police finally caught the thief last night
We need to catch mice in the basement
I think I'm catching a cold from you
Don't stand too close you might catch flu

definitions: put something over or in front of something else
deal with or include a particular topic or subject
travel a particular distance or area
examples: Cover the food to keep flies away please
Snow covered the ground overnight completely white
This course covers modern European history thoroughly well
The insurance covers damage from natural disasters only
We covered twenty miles before lunch today impressively
The sales team covers the entire eastern region

definitions: give a detailed account of something in words
represent or characterize something using words
mark out or trace the outline or shape
examples: Can you describe what the suspect looked like
The witness described the accident in detail carefully
Words cannot describe how beautiful the sunset was
How would you describe your management style exactly
The motion of planets describes an elliptical orbit
His hand described a circle in the air

definitions: estimate or suppose something without sufficient information
suppose or think something is probable or likely
arrive at a correct answer by guessing
examples: Can you guess how many jellybeans are here
I'd guess she's about thirty years old maybe
I guess you're right about that issue probably
I guess we should leave now before traffic
She guessed the answer on the test correctly
Can you guess the riddle I'm thinking of

definitions: position oneself with the front toward something
confront and deal with something difficult or unpleasant
cover the front surface of something
examples: Please face the camera and smile naturally now
The house faces south for maximum sunlight exposure
We must face our fears to overcome them
It's time to face the truth about this situation
They plan to face the building with marble
The contractor will face the wall with brick

definitions: examine something to determine accuracy quality or condition
stop or slow the progress or movement of something
mark something with a check mark symbol
examples: Please check your answers before submitting the test
I need to check my email for important messages
We must check the spread of this disease quickly
The new regulations check corporate power effectively well
Check the box if you agree with the statement
The teacher checked each correct answer on tests

definitions: take part in a violent struggle or physical combat
struggle against something harmful or undesirable
have an angry argument or disagreement
examples: The soldiers fought bravely in the battle yesterday
Two men were fighting outside the bar last night
We must fight poverty in our community together
She's fighting cancer with incredible courage and determination
My parents fight about money all the time
Stop fighting with your sister over toys please

definitions: make manufacture or create something from raw materials
cause something to happen or come into existence
show or provide something as evidence or for inspection
examples: This factory produces cars for export markets worldwide
Local farms produce organic vegetables year-round here
Hard work produces good results over time consistently
The medication produced unexpected side effects in patients
Please produce your identification at the checkpoint now
The lawyer produced new evidence during the trial

definitions: propel something through the air with force
move or put something somewhere forcefully or carelessly
confuse or disconcert someone
examples: Throw the ball to first base quickly now
Don't throw stones at the window please
She threw her bag on the couch angrily
He threw himself into the new project enthusiastically
Your question really threw me for a moment
Don't let criticism throw you off your game

definitions: feel concern or interest about something or someone
look after and provide for needs of someone
have a preference or liking for something
examples: I really care about environmental issues deeply today
She cares what people think of her unfortunately
Who will care for the children this weekend
Nurses care for patients twenty-four hours daily
I don't care which restaurant we choose tonight
Would you care for some tea or coffee

definitions: fire a bullet or projectile from a weapon
photograph or make a film of something
move suddenly or rapidly in a direction
examples: Don't shoot the gun near residential areas please
The hunter shot a deer during hunting season
They're shooting a movie downtown this week excitingly
Can I shoot some photos of your garden
The car shot past us at high speed
Pain shot through my arm suddenly without warning

definitions: fail to remember information or past events
accidentally leave something behind or not bring it
deliberately stop thinking about something unpleasant
examples: I always forget people's names at parties embarrassingly
Don't forget to lock the door when leaving
I forgot my umbrella at the restaurant yesterday
She forgot her homework at home this morning
Try to forget about your troubles for tonight
Forget what I said I was just angry

definitions: concentrate attention or effort on something specific
adjust a lens or eye to see clearly
the center of interest or activity
examples: Please focus on your studies this semester seriously
I can't focus with all this noise around me
Focus the microscope to see the cells clearly
The camera won't focus in low light conditions
The focus of the meeting is budget planning
Children became the focus of her life completely

definitions: indicate a direction or position with a finger
the sharp or tapered end of something
a particular moment in time or stage
examples: Don't point at people it's rude behavior
The sign points toward the exit clearly
Be careful of the sharp point on that pencil
The point of the needle broke off unfortunately
At what point did you realize the mistake
We've reached a critical point in negotiations now

definitions: notice or pay particular attention to something
write down briefly as a record or reminder
a single tone of definite pitch in music
examples: Please note the change in schedule this week
I noted several errors in the report yesterday
Note this number for future reference please quickly
She noted the main points during the lecture
Can you play that note again on piano
The singer hit a perfect high note beautifully

definitions: make or cause to make a noise
give a particular impression when heard or read
measure the depth of water
examples: The alarm sounds at six every morning loudly
Sound the horn to warn other drivers please
Your idea sounds interesting tell me more details
That sounds like a good plan to me
They sound the harbor depth twice daily regularly
Sailors must sound unfamiliar waters carefully always
